Reviews.Title: “hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: epicNewYork
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel and its location. I stayed in La Ramblas during my last visit and this was such a wonderful change in location. You are between the Gracia and the tourist area. If you are looking to between McDonald's and Starbucks and close to the Hop on/Hop off bus..stay elsewhere. This hotel was suggested to me by locals because they hang out in Gracia...not La Ramblas. You are still a short walk to all things Gaudi but you are near wonderful local pastry shops and restaurants and true Catalonia. My suggestion: Read TIME OF THE DOVES when you stay here and take a walk to the square in Gracia that inspired the novel. The hotel has retained retro detail and old time service. The staff was amazing...A special thanks to Jemma and Monica.

Reviews.Title: “Good Position, comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from four nights at this hotel. very comfortable clean, well appointed room. excellent breakfast. very convenient for Diagonal Metro station and only a few minutes from the Rambla and two Gaudi houses. Lts of excellent restaurants to choose from within five minutes walk. Make a right outside the hotel then 50 metres and right again and you will find an excellent supermarket across the street

Reviews.Title: “A decent stay with free Wi-Fi”
Reviews.Author: mkennedy38
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this well located hotel during a 4 day stay in Barcelona. The hotel is in an area that is much quieter than the city center; however it is an easy 20 minute walk to the Las Ramblas. An ATM and multiple restaurants are located just around the corner. In the lobby there was a computer with complimentary internet access. Free Wi-Fi is conveniently available in each room. My room was well stocked and tiny. We did hear noise from other rooms frequently. Check in and checkout was smooth. All the desk staff that we encountered spoke fluent English, which was a great since my Castillan is lacking. The restaurant was okay with good service. The breakfast had a descent selection but was not well managed. Once items were depleted they did not seem to be replenished (e.g. glassware, juice, jam). Food and room service were a little pricey for the class of the hotel. Regardless, we would both stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: KajsaK
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying in this beautiful hotel! It was close to everything. With Paseo de Gracia just around the corner with all the shopping you need. And with Sagrada Familia really close in the other direction. To walk to la rambla or the old town just take 15 min. The hotel was clean and modern and had a good breakfast buffet. All the staff was really friendly and helpful and that made me feel extra confortable! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: unholywolf
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed at the Catalonia la Pedrera 3 nights. Overall the hotel is not bad, wifi is free, we were on the 6th floor and the signal was ok. Room space is decent with enough room in the wardrobe, bathroom is big and it has a bidet (if you’re italian you know that is a big thing that is usually missing when you travel in Europe, if you’re not italian you may want to try it  ). Unfortunately my girlfriend was sick during the holiday and I got sick too. What this has to do with the hotel you would say? It has to do that the temperature was way too high inside the room and we weren’t able to control it due to the fact that the thermostat was disabled. Also, due to the high fever we had to order dinner in the room, some bits of seasonal fruit was 9 euro and a plate with some cheese and ham was 19euros. I found these prices to be a bit high. Apart from that I have to say the staff was nice, the position is amazing (just 5 minutes or less walk from diagonal station and therefore passeig de gracia), plenty of restaurant and all the things you may need just a few minutes walk or right outside the hotel. Also there was a phone ringing the whole night (I’m not joking, when I say whole I mean whole) but to be honest we didn’t ask the reception to find out from were it came. Walls are tiny and you can hear everything.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: dimsumchef
Reviews.Content: We took a suite on the 7th floor. Nice enough, clean and comfortable. Had a view to the Tibidabo church on the mountain. The bed sheets, blankets, towels and bath accessories are OK but not the level of a 4 star hotel though. The hotel is located in an unremarkable street. However, the Diagonal Metro station is only a 5 minute walk from the hotel with easy access to all the nice loactions. The Sagrada Familiga cathedral is a nice 15 minute walk. Wifi is a free and works fine. For a simple breakfast turn right from the lobby and walk 100ft to the street corner. There is a small simple restaurant that serves excellent coffee and good local sandwiches.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable for overnight transit”
Reviews.Author: drsh99
Reviews.Content: I had an overnight transit through Barcelona and picked this hotel at the last minute on hotels.com or booking.com as it had a very good sale price. The map showed it was fairly centrally-located, so I figured there would be restaurants nearby, but it was not too close to the Plaza Catalunya since there was a soccer match between Barcelona and Real Madrid that night. Even though the game was played in Madrid, I knew that the crowds would be in the central plaza regardless of the outcome (and they were still stragglers when I left for the airport at 5:30am). The hotel was very clean and comfortable, the reception staff was extremely helpful in guiding me toward restaurants nearby that were ideal for a woman traveling alone. I had a delicious meal at a tapas bar/tavern just around the corner from the restaurant (to the left and left again as you exit the hotel). The room was very clean and minimalist, which I prefer. The bed was firm and both the room and bath were more spacious than I've had in a lot of European hotels. And, best of all, it was absolutely SILENT. A quiet hotel while staying in a city is a real bonus. I've had very good experiences at a number of hotels in the Catalonia line in Madrid, so I will continue booking in one or another on my frequent trips to and through Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and reasonably okay Feb 2011”
Reviews.Author: travellingdoris
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel last minute by walking through the front door. The property is clean and I found the staff helpful. My scribbled notes in my day book remind me that the bed was a real king size but very very hard. As the only other note to self is regarding 'not worth full price' and also that I didn't write anything horrible, my recollection is that it isn't a 4 star but a 3 star 'want to be'. Acceptable but not memorable. I think my window looked out onto someone else's window - fine as I didn't book in for the view. I recall that the bathroom was a decent size and that it was well lit. I didn't use the bar or restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, Noisy but good location”
Reviews.Author: Manuel P
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very good location, close to Paseo de Gracia, Close to subway stations and close to main Gaudi attractions La Pedrera y Batllo However is too expensive for what it offers: - Room size Ok - VERY noisy!!! If you are tired and want to sleep until late morning, forget it!!!! You will hear every single noise in the building specially the maids cleaning the rooms, every steps cracks the hotel. - Beds are very uncomfortable, I got a terrible back ache at the end of my vacation One good thing, service is great and personnel are very kind

Reviews.Title: “Perfect way to end a vacation in Spain!”
Reviews.Author: lenabun
Reviews.Content: We were so pleased w/services & room standard. While many indicated rooms were small, I was quite impressed by size especially considering price. Beds were extremely comfortable... love the pillows in Spain! The room greeted us w/nice fragrance. The bathroom was huge equipped with shampoo and such. The central location was amazing. We walked everywhere and the Gaudy apartment building was only a block away! Hop-on bus, a 5 minute walk that is also ontop of Gracias Blvd that leads to Ramblas We arrived late in the eveniing. Cab took about 1/2 hour from airport, 35 Euros for 4 w/baggage. Katerina at the desk was MOST helpful especially with free WiFI connection. Coffee bar in hotel started morning off. Preferred light breakfast outside. Safe keys always seem to be extra cost in Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Basic, Reasonable Location”
Reviews.Author: MarkLaurence
Reviews.Content: This hotel is comfortable and clean with a good breakfast buffet by European standards. It is reasonably well located with an easy 20 minute walk to the centre of things. We walked everywhere including Las Ramblas and the Harbour area. The hotel rooms are small but most are in Europe. All in all it was a good choice but next time I would stay a little closer to the Las Ramblas area I think - not because it is the tourist strip but because it is closer for shopping, sightseeing and the Gothic Quarter. Free wifi internet was a definite bonus.

Reviews.Title: “not more than 3 stars”
Reviews.Author: ahmodium
Reviews.Content: i went with my wife & my baby and stayed 4 nights there i didnt like the hotel for these reasons: very bad ventilation in the room.. the room smell was very bad small tight beds...room is a very small location is far from placa catalonia the hotel lobby is very small no place to sitt safety box is 5 euro per day !! and u have to pay 40 euro as a deposite even if u will stay 2 days!! the breackfast was good...the staff is friendly.. at the end i think its not more than 3 stars not 4

Reviews.Title: “A well situated hotel”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethChester
Reviews.Content: La Pedrera is five minutes walk from a metro station and from the ordinary and tourist bus stops on Passeig de Gracia. The view from our bedroom window was of a wall, but at least we could open the window and the room was quiet. The bed was comfortable and there was a fridge. The safe was charged at a daily rate. The bathroom was well appointed. Breakfast was self-service with a good variety of food. All staff were helpful and efficient. The hotel was full. Some guests, who wanted to extend their stay, were unable to do so.

Reviews.Title: “more three than four-star”
Reviews.Author: jenny186337
Reviews.Content: lacking cleanliness and attention-no towels one day-bathroom floors not cleaned during stay Breakfast good internet did`nt work

Reviews.Title: “hm..I do not reccomend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: n06
Reviews.Content: ok, the location is more than great BUT extremely small and uncomfortable bed - pretty noisy and overall not in anyway a 4 start hotel. They should charge 30% lowest rates.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, good location”
Reviews.Author: Giza1199
Reviews.Content: Catalonia Corcega is a small and affordable hotel in a great location in Barcelona. I recommend it to others that want a good value and convenience. The staff is helpful and professional - in particular Manuel was a great source of information and pleasant assistance.

Reviews.Title: “horrible”
Reviews.Author: lindalou87
Reviews.Content: I have been for three days in Roma in Massimo d'Azeglio **** and it was magnificant. Then i went to Catalonia Corcega **** and it was horrible. it does not deserve 4 stars but 1 or 2. They have a little reception, a little bar and even the double room is little. Furthermore, you have to pay for thebreakfast. I was in Firenze in Corona d'Italia *** and it was so much better then Catalonia Corcega; the double room bigger, the bar bigger and the breakfast was included. Catalonia Corcega has an open restaurent so everybody who isn't staying at the hotel can enter the restaurent including criminals and thieves. Actually i was stolen the second day when i was having breakfast at the hotel. Someone not from the hotel came in pretending to have breakfast and stole my handbag. My handbag was stretched over the back of the chair I was sitting down and that someone sat behind me, took my bag and then he left without anyone noticing anything. He was filmed by the camera. the manager of the hotel told me to go to the police and then only they can send the video to the police. I payed a taxi and went to the police station. It was only the next day that the hotel sent the video to the police. When i told the manager that i wanted to see the video again and to have a copy of it he said that it was impossible. Even if i was in the responsibility of the hotel when i was stolen it was all what he did for me; sending the video to the police. I really don't recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3/4 Star Hotel in Safe Area near Lots of Modernistic Buildings”
Reviews.Author: Dapprman
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried when I booked this hotel that it was a bit far out, however three famous buildings are within 2 minutes walk (Casa del Punxes, Casa Asia, and Casa Comalat), Sagrada Familia is under 10 minutes walk away, and the main shopping street with Casa Mila, Casa Batllo, Casa Amatler, .... is only about 3-4 minutes off (with those building all being within a further 3-10 minutes walk). For other areas there's two Metro stations near by, though looking at a map is deceptive - Diagonal is far closer than Verdaguer. The hotel is small, but clean. Service is ok, but sufficient. The main lift is small (only really 5-6 people) and slow - but as this is a small hotel that should not be an issue. It's in a quiet area, though with lots of small bars near by. The rooms are a decent size by European size (I suspect all the people here complaining they were too small are Americans used to US sized hotels). The bed was hard (my preference) and comfortable, and the bathroom well was equipped. Oddly there's no tea/coffee facilities, and while there is a safe in the room, there's no lock in it - you have to pay an extra €5 a day for it's secure use - a little odd, however for those with laptops, wireless Internet access was free.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant helpful staff that tried everything to make our stay a good one”
Reviews.Author: serenityhouse205
Reviews.Content: We Were the Pensioners party of nine WHO HAD Arrived in Barcelona to find Our HAD Sold Our original hotel rooms! we found the Corsica and Manuel on the desk Was most helpful and efficient. The rooms were clean and comfortable with all the facilities Expected of a 4 * Hotel. The restaurant staff were welcoming and the food choice was good. Overall the hotel is to be recommended for STI and helpfulness in Every aspect Certainly we would use it on Our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “like coming home”
Reviews.Author: fleckhilo
Reviews.Content: the corsega is welcoming and a pleasure to stay in.It could do with a more inviting decor in reception .it's not the smartest hotel 'but.... it's position couldn't be better for easy access of all the main Gaudi architecture.everything is within walking distance and i feel very safe walking around this area late at night.The hotel accomodation is great .spacious and clean.the staff are always friendly and helpfull and the chef always has something special to tempt you to 'eat in'.I have stayed a few times now and my opinion still stands.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: simonsimonsimon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a working trip here and it was a fabulous hotel. The hotel is very clean and the rooms are modern. There is what looked like an old balcony (it is still there) but the door handle is not on there any more. so dont expect a balcony. Was not bothered about the view as we did not spend much time in the room. I was in a single, but had a large double and when we checked in, we ventured out, and came back and we had a bottle of wine and a fruit bowl left in our room and compliments of the manager (possibly to do with our job role) The location is brilliant. I must warn you though, do not go by google maps as it is in the complete wrong direction. The hotel is inbetween Diagonal and Verdaguar metro stops, not by the Hospital. Which makes it a better location that it is on google maps! The breakfast was basic but nice and the staff were very friendly. Checked in and out with ease. Overall a very pleseant stay at the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Your Stuff May Just Disappear!!!!”
Reviews.Author: VeryPickyLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: - Room: nice clean and renovated. Very big. We had a separate TV room and a big balcony!! However, both TVs in room didn't work!!! We didn't mind since we were tired at night anyway. - Breakfast: Lots of choices but greasy - No nice communal area. You basically come in and go to your room - Location: close to Passeig de Gracia - Far from Rambla or port. Location felt very safe but if you want to walk to places, this is going to be a long walk. - Service: Cleaning lady moves your stuff!!!! I travel 50% of my work time and never use closet and keep my stuff in bag. The cleaning lady put my clothes in the closet and closed the closet door. We didn't check it when leaving. I called and they charged me 45 Euro to send me back my stuff. I agreed since my expensive brand belt was left there. Guess what? My cheap old clothes arrived AND THE BELT DISAPPEARED!!!!! I called and emailed and they just ignored me. Somebody there liked my belt and just decided to keep it AND charge me 45 for sending back my dirty t-shirts!!!!!!! Now I call this really really really bad service. Very unprofessional and not acceptable for a 3 or 4 star hotel. I don't feel safe in this hotel and am lucky that only my belt is disappeared, since if they take a belt they may take whatever precious!!! I wouldn't go back or if I were you, I wouldn't take any precious items around!!! Also the concierge is not helpful at all. While staying there we asked couple questions and they just acted as if we are annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: justineStokeonTrent
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband went to the Catalonia Corsega for a city break earlier this month. The hotel was very clean and very quiet. It is in an excellent position to visit the Sagrada Familiar by foot. The only thing I would warn people about is the road the hotel is situated on - Calle de Corsega is a long road that runs across the city with the Passage de Gracia running through the middle, we took the bus from the airport and got off in the centre. It isnt clear on the directions and we turned the wrong way down the road, altogether it took us 2 hours to find the hotel. The breakfast was really good with a wide choice. We found all the staff to be pleasant and would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico!! Lovely little gem!”
Reviews.Author: OllieDulcie
Reviews.Content: I took my son to Barcelona for his 13th birthday. We loved this hotel. We felt well cared for by the friendly staff. Twin Room was clean, restful, and marble bathroom especially nice. Sleek interior design and lighting made it seem very glamorous, while the old architectural details in the central lift stairwell and lobby columns gave a European quaint feeling. The breakfast buffet was excellent with abundant food, gracious setting and service. We ate heartily each morning, set off for sightseeing, then had a prix fixe lunch or tapas around 2pm, and back to the hotel for rest. The location was quiet (August -- so many neighborhood businesses were closed) and safe. We could easily navigate from our hotel, plan our day, and take the metro, bus or walk. The stations were all within about 20 minutes walk. Several beautiful Gaudi buildings were nearby, as well as rows of early 1900s apartments with balconies. It reminded me of some of the small boutique hotels in NYC (which European travelers favor). We felt " quite continental " at the Corsega Catalonia.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ansel75
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend (i.e. we’re two 33 yr old laydeeeez). Breakfast was very good (although the tea was a little weak and not hot how us British like it!). It's about 20 mins walk to Las Ramblas (whilst walking you pass many designer shops, coffee shops and bars). The sight-seeing bus pick-up point is about 5-10 min walk (in the same direction to Las Ramblas),where you can pick up buses which tour either north or south of the city. Although the hotel is on the outskirts of the hustle & bustle, it's nice and quiet (so you can sleep in peacefully). We didn't hear any of our neighbours. The road outside seemed to get busy with traffic, but there’s double-glazing, so not a problem, but then we were on the 6th floor. There are black-out curtains. The safe is 4 Euros/per day (40 Euros deposit). The tv could be better, the only English speaking channel was CNN (there are pay per view films). Lots of mirrors throughout which is great when you’re getting ready. The room isn’t especially luxurious, quite basic looking really, but it’s clean and comfortable. Bathroom is clean, with a bath & good shower. There’s a fridge, but no tea & coffee making facilities. Most people at reception spoke good English, but you can get by without too much of a problem. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: ChesterManchester
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Barcelona and found the hotel to be everything the other views have stated. The hotel was very clean and comfy. The bedroom was the same and the king-size bed was fantastic. Air conditioning was a great relief and the black out curtains were a real plus. At 10am it felt like midnight..only the traffic noise from the single glazed windows gave away the time.Bathrooms again were good but a little dated. The breakfast was good with plenty of choice but the hot dishes were barely luke warm. The staff were reasonably friendly but you have to accept that that you are in Catalunya and most people in Barcelona are ignorant and not hospitable. Service in most restaurants and bars I found to be poor with a couldn't care less attitude..compared to the more Southern parts of Spain. If you try speaking a little Spanish they ignore you...just stick to English as they understand every word you say. Use the tour buses..19 euros for 1 day or 23 euros for 2 days gives excellent value. Just beware that you will ripped off in the bars at Port Olympico....11 euros for 2 bottles of lager is a scandle!! The hotel is a fair way from the main drag of Passeig de Gracia but there is still a lot of decent bars/restaurants in the area...well worth the £90 per night..!!

Reviews.Title: “Good.. sort of.”
Reviews.Author: Jesse_Holmes
Reviews.Content: The location is great - a short walk to the Barri Gotic and Passage de Gracia with plenty of opportunities to stop off for coffee (or beer/wine) on the way. The room that we had was very small. Well more narrow than small, and had absolutely no view (i.e. coundn't see sky). Our travelling companion had a larger room with a really good view, so there you go! This didn't really bother us, as we only had three nights in the city so not much time was spent in the room. Overall the hotel is clean and the staff friendly. Would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, clean and friendly A+++++++++++”
Reviews.Author: Loosbrock
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on a 14 day Mediterranean cruise that ended in Barcelona and we were staying here for 2 extra days. We now wish we would have added a few more days, because as we found out 2 days was not enough. We were a little concerned when we started to drive to the hotel area that we were staying too far away from everything.. but there was a lot to do EVERYWHERE! We did have a bit of a walk to the main "strip" area but it was enjoyable to walk and look at all the buildings, people and everything going on there. If you did not want to walk you could easily take many means of transportation like get an all day bus pass, get a taxi or just hop on a bus. It was just a short walk to the main street to catch one. The hotel was very clean, staff very friendly.. the room size that we had was great, very large. The bathroom was also nice and big. With coming off of a boat for 2 weeks we had a lot of suitcases and it was nice to be able to put them somewhere and not be tripping over them for the 2 days we were in the room. We had a back room so we had no view, I think its kind of hard to have a nice view in Barcelona since its nothing but buildings all over the place one on top of another (unless you ask for something facing the front street) It was very quiet, we heard no noise at all from inside or outside. Beds seemed comfortable.. Funny thing to us was we had no idea on how to turn the lights and the air on. First time we were at a place that you had to put your room card in a slot to make the lights work!!! We thought the power was out to the room when we first walked in.. he he But best of all I have to say the FREE breakfast was amazing. They had such a assortment of things out it was more like a lunch buffet!! If you ate a nice size breakfast you did not have to eat lunch till late. All kinds of juices, pastries, breads and then your eggs along with ham, bacon and more.. It was worth it just for the breakfast! Our travel agent may have told us that breakfast was included but we forgot:) So it was a nice surprise when my husband went downstairs to get me juice and found that out.. So maybe you can just get the room with out breakfast included?? Not sure on that, you might want to check at time of booking if breakfast is included for sure, trust me again its worth it. Only took pictures of the outside... did want to take bathroom pictures since it was so impressive.. Oh yes and they do give you a basket full of things left in your bathroom; luffah sponge, nail file, soap, shampoo, conditioner, comb, tooth brush, toothpaste, shoe shine kit and that type of stuff. I took the luffa and packed it in my suitcase the first day to give to someone at home as a joke (actually a nice size one) and the next day there was another one there!! NICE!!! I would recommend this and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Catalonia Corsega Hotel. Plus for quality. Minus for location.”
Reviews.Author: JCM1949
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Catalonia Corsega hotel in Barcelona in July 2006. It is a lovely business style hotel. Inviting lobby, comfortable and clean rooms, large marble bath, mini fridge, and COLD air conditioning. STaff was polite and helpful. Got a rate of 75 euros on the Internet. Unfortunately, it is not in a good location for visiting the major sites. There is nothing much to see close by, and it is a good 10 minute walk to the Metro station. We like to stay near the center of historic sites so we can come back to the hotel to rest and freshen up. Nest trip we will try for a hotel closer to Las Ramblas or one of the major squares. We were warned by other tourists, though, that some of the older hotels near Las Ramblas don't have cold air conditioning, so check that out before making summer reservations.
